meanings.definition: Having small lines or folds on the surface
meanings.sent1: The old book had wrinkled pages.
meanings.sent2: Her wrinkled hands showed her age.
meanings.sent3: The wrinkled paper looked like a crumpled map.
meanings.sent4: The wrinkled fabric resembled a dried-up riverbed.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkled leaves rustled in the wind.

meanings.definition: To make small lines or folds on the surface
meanings.sent1: She wrinkled her nose in disgust.
meanings.sent2: He wrinkled the paper to create a texture.
meanings.sent3: The chef wrinkled his brow in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The wind wrinkled the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The artist wrinkled the clay to add detail to the sculpture.
